title: Hospitality veteran Debbie Southworth joins AlliedPRA Hawaii as General Manager
text:
Hospitality veteran Debbie Southworth joins AlliedPRA Hawaii as General Manager Hospitality veteran Debbie Southworth joins AlliedPRA Hawaii as General Manager Details Category: Appointments   10:45 AlliedPRA, Inc., a global leader in the Destination Management Company (DMC) sector, announces its newest member to the AlliedPRA Hawaii team, hospitality veteran Debbie Southworth, LES, serving as General Manager, according to Ferris Suér, Principal of AlliedPRA Hawaii. As General Manager, Southworth is responsible for new business development, increasing revenue streams and overseeing all operations for the AlliedPRA Hawaii team, while continuing to build strong relationships with local partner suppliers to firmly establish AlliedPRA Hawaii as the industry leader for DMC requirements in the Aloha state. 
Southworth joins AlliedPRA after a long and diverse career in hospitality. Originally from Ohio, she spent over a decade as a Meeting Planner for a utility company. She thrives on building relationships and creating event experiences, a passion that she took with her to her role as Director of Catering & Convention Services at a variety of hotel properties around the country. Most recently, she served as the Director of Meetings & Special Events for The Ritz-Carlton Lodge, Reynolds Plantation for five years where she worked closely to increase group business and oversee the Meetings, Special Events, A/V and Banquets teams. Her previous experience includes meeting planning, catering and convention services at a number of high-profile resort properties. “With over 30 years of hospitality experience, Debbie has experienced a diverse opportunity to interact with a variety of professional levels throughout the years. Her wealth of knowledge of events, management, meeting planning and hotels combined are a perfect match for the role of General Manager of AlliedPRA Hawaii,” shared Suer. “She brings a fresh, positive approach to our dynamic team, providing our sales group with a unique insight of the importance in working with all local partners to create strategic alliances and further expand our service offerings to our valued existing and future clients that choose Hawaii as their incentive or corporate group destination. We are excited about the new vision and leadership she brings to the team.” The Hawaiian Islands offer amenities to meet every budget requirement with outstanding hotels and resorts. With over 70,000 hotel rooms spread throughout Hawaii’s six islands, there is a wide array from which travelers can choose. Just a short distance from the Hawaii Convention Center, there are over 25,000 rooms with easy access to O’ahu’s most popular destinations, including the famous Waikiki Beach. Hawaii appeals to business travelers worldwide, offering an enticing destination location ideal for conducting business effortlessly. Related articles
